content: Given an induced (by the usual inclusion map) topological space X from another space Y, with X being contained in Y, how can I obtain this definition (or an equivalent one) of the induced topology on X, in order to talk about the open sets of the subspace X in relation to the open sets in Y?

docs#instTopologicalSpaceSubtype is probably what you want (and in general the things around docs#TopologicalSpace.induced), but in all probability you wonâ€™t have to do anything, lean should be able to infer everything by itself
Joseph Cooper has marked this topic as resolved.
